September 21, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.

722985f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

722986f-a.text:
116 to 120 Rivington Street, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Essex Street. The 2-story building shown (No. 120) was an old theatre (abandoned) which in conjunction with No. 134 Essex Street, formed an "V'. These buildings have been demolished (1930), as a part of the widening of Essex Street.
April 22, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
722986f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY
